title: How to Fix Your Mp3 Player That Got Wet

steps.headline: Do not attempt to turn it on.
Remove the battery from the MP3 player.
Pour alcohol on/in it, all the way.
steps.description: It is recommended dipping it in a container with alcohol (This will help push the water out).

steps.headline: Wrap it up with a white paper towel
Let it dry in the sunlight for at least 3 hours.
Connect it to your computer/charger and leave it connected even if it does not turn on.
Remove the battery immediately.
steps.description: (Put on hold if it has a built-in battery.)

steps.headline: Stick it in a bowl of rice for 2-3 days.
steps.description: The rice sucks out the moisture from the device.

text: Steps Do not attempt to turn it on.  Remove the battery from the MP3 player.  Pour alcohol on/in it, all the way. It is recommended dipping it in a container with alcohol (This will help push the water out). Shake it.  Wrap it up with a white paper towel  Let it dry in the sunlight for at least 3 hours.  Connect it to your computer/charger and leave it connected even if it does not turn on.  Method 2 Do not turn it on.  Remove the battery immediately. (Put on hold if it has a built-in battery.) Dry it off.  Stick it in a bowl of rice for 2-3 days. The rice sucks out the moisture from the device.
sentences: Steps Do not attempt to turn it on.
Remove the battery from the MP3 player.
Pour alcohol on/in it, all the way.
It is recommended dipping it in a container with alcohol (This will help push the water out).
Wrap it up with a white paper towel  Let it dry in the sunlight for at least 3 hours.
Connect it to your computer/charger and leave it connected even if it does not turn on.
Method 2 Do not turn it on.
(Put on hold if it has a built-in battery.)
Stick it in a bowl of rice for 2-3 days.
The rice sucks out the moisture from the device.
